intro: Melandrium album subsp. eriocalycinum, commonly known as the white campion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in temperate regions.
